intro: Hieracium subconicum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often narrowed at the base. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from June to August. Hieracium subconicum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed sites, thriving in well-drained soils.
